page.title: 09Maltby Miners' Institute
page.content: Maltby Miners' Welfare Institute,or the 'Stute'as it is locally known, provides for the recreation and entertainment of the members. Indoor sports include dominoes,cards,darts, snooker and pool. Sixteen other pubs and clubs take part in competitions with the 'Stute'. Outdoor sports include bowls,football and cricket. The club field is called the"main". This is used for games,the miners' gala and for whippet racing. The 'Stute' is situated on Muglet Lane close to the Model Village. Many miners live nearby and in the newer estate of Birk's Holt,known as Scotch Alley. Many miners gather at the 'Stute' for a chat over a pint of beer at the end of their shift. It is busy on pay day when entertainment is provided.
